item.description:
A dice rolling and flipping game with Flip Dice in which players try to make 22 (the total of the high sides of the set of four Flip Dice). In attempting to do so, players must choose to press their luck and play (at the risk of having to double the pot of chips if they roll all the low sides of the Flip Dice) or play it safe, pass their turn, and hope someone else loses.

Once one player loses all their chips at the end of a turn, the other players with chips remaining record their number of chips left (as points). Then a new round is started and play continues until someone reaches 50 points.

A set of nine multi-purpose dice featuring Hello Kitty and friends. Use the dice for learning activities or memory and story-telling games. Similar to Rory's Story Cubes

Learn a word:
In this most basic play, players roll the dice and call out who or what they see.

Build a Sentence: 
On your turn roll any two dice and make up a sentence that uses both images.

Tell a story: 
Roll all the dice. The youngest player takes any die and starts a story that uses the image on the die. Moving to the left, each player takes any remaining die and adds on to the story.

Memory: 
Roll all the dice. Players look at the face-up images for 20 
seconds; the dice are then hidden from the players’ view. Players call out the images they remember while the host tells whether they are correct or not.

Past/Present/Future:
For older kids – players roll one or more dice and build a sentence using a variety of tenses. “Hello Kitty scored a point playing soccer.” “If it’s sunny tomorrow, Hello Kitty will play soccer.”

Contents: 
9 Story Telling Dice, 
Storage bag

name.value: Martial Arts: The Card Game – Series 2

item.description:
Introducing Series 2 of Martial Arts: The Card Game, a 2-4 player deckbuilding game that focuses on real martial arts rather than flying off walls and throwing fireballs. Using our Velocity Engine, you can pick up a deck and play as a different martial art style using strategy, speed, and quick thinking without having to micromanage your decks. Because this is also a deck building game, you can mix and match any of the cards from Series 2 or 1 and create your own fighting style, much like a honed practitioner would.

Play as "Anything Goes" where weapons and illegal moves are ok or try our different modes, like playing solo or Army of One where you can have up to 10 players!

Series 2 includes these pre-constructed deck styles:


 Sumo
 Drunken Fist
 Tae Kwon Do
 Shaolin Kung Fu
 Brazilian Jujitsu
 Capoeira

Timeline: Québec is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts a historical event on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: Québec can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

Card represent event related to the culture of the province of Québec in Canada.

From the back of the box:

Brainpucks is a game of strategy that combines the simplicity of tic-tac-toe, the game of chess and the thrill of hockey.

Be the first player to align 4 pucks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal fashion. Personalize your game board with your favourite team logos!

There's no question: the life of an artist is hard. There’s no paycheck to paycheck to live by. What little money you do have you invest right back into paint. And without that paint, there’s no way to follow your dream. You don’t relish the idea of having to work at a desk, in front a computer, toiling away for some faceless corporate overlord. You really want to make it!

Starving Artists is a game for 2-4 players. It takes about 30-60 minutes (approximately 15 minutes per player).

In Starving Artists, you are a painter trying to be famous. In the game, paints are the only currency. On your turn, you can buy canvases, paint them or work for more paint. And, at the end of each round, players can put their completed paintings up for sale for more paint and food.

The game ends when shortly after someone is out or someone manages to paint enough paintings: either in value or quantity. Yes, you can become famous by flooding the painting marketplace.

item.description:
A frightening virus, Virus Q, is spreading in the major cities of the planet. Infected people and animals change rapidly, becoming horrible bloodthirsty and almost unstoppable creatures. Our only hope is to find the zero patient and the place where everything originated. There, perhaps, we can find an antidote and return the hope to the dying humanity.

But not everyone agrees. There are those who want to take advantage of the chaos and terror in order to gain power and establish a new form of government, trying to maneuver and control the monsters generated by the virus. A cure would ruin their plans forever.

The virus was created in a secret military lab, in a space that's practically inaccessible. Inside, Virus Q spread for the first time, accidentally, maybe; the creatures that now inhabit the Lab are difficult even to imagine...

In the innovative lab crawler game Virus, players are the team that infiltrates the Lab looking for the antidote to Virus Q. They will collect the few and fragmentary bits of information scattered in the laboratory, avoiding or fighting the monsters that populate it.

The map generation and the movement/placement of monsters depends on the player actions with a semi-automatic mechanism controlling what takes place where. The fighting requires some dexterity elements as well as players must plan their tactics by combining their shooting power with available movement, achieving successes by rolling cubes.

Also, the game takes place in real time!

In sum, you can play Virus cooperatively, semi-cooperatively or competitively. The "infiltrator" option makes the game even more exciting and unpredictable!

item.description:
Savage's Station is the third game in the Blood Before Richmond series, following Gaines's Mill and Glendale & White Oak Swamp; it actually takes place between those two.

The story of the Seven Days is the story of bizarrely incompetent leaders and badly-timed attacks, but Savage's Station really takes the cake. The usually wily Rebel general "Prince John" Magruder is charged with leading an attack on the lightly-defended Union rear, to be supported by three divisions under Stonewall Jackson. Jackson got confused and never showed (surprise-surprise), and Magruder, stoned out of his gourd on morphine, dragged his feet all day before finally launching a half-hearted assault after 5PM, which was ended by a sudden thunderstorm.

This is the smallest (and weirdest) of the games in the Blood Before Richmond series (only a half-sheet of counters this time around), and it's all about taking chances. The Confederate Player can bring in extra units, such as the famous Land Merrimack (a rail-mounted naval gun), but at the cost of precious VP. Will he have enough time to make up the difference, or will the game be called on account of rain?

item.description:
This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

This particular entry in the series has trivia questions on some cards meant specifically for children, although there's no guarantee they'll be any easier to answer without specific local knowledge.

The object of Wabbits is to win four carrots by forming words fast. You form four-letter words by pairing up word bit cards or tiles from your hand and/or from the supply pool in the middle of the table. Word bits are fixed two-letter combinations that can form words when combined correctly.

Examples:

WO + RD = WORD

PL + AY = PLAY

It takes two word bits to form a word, and you must use all of your cards/tiles. At any time and as often as you want, you can discard any unwanted word bit by putting the card/tile face up in the pool and picking up a new or discarded one. Go fast; up to a dozen others are forming words at the same time as you!

It doesn’t matter if you are a BUNNY, RABBIT, HARE, or JACKRABBIT! When skill levels differ greatly, level the playing field by using the skill cards which are numbered from 1 (beginner) to 8 (expert). The number in one’s card is the number of words one has to form. Less experienced players can win because they need to form fewer words. Whoever finishes first gets the carrot!

And the more you win, the harder it gets to keep winning! After winning a carrot, your target number of words goes up by one for the next round.

Players leading during a game have to work harder for the next carrot, and so the others always have a good chance of catching up. The game is never over until the last carrot has been won.

name.value: Monsutā Fesutibaru ~ dai shuryō-sai kyōsan: Arisumetika renkin shōkai ~
モンスター・フェスティバル ～大狩猟祭 協賛：アリスメティク錬金商会～

item.description:
Operational level game of the counterinsurgency campaign in 1969 in Binh Dinh province, central coast of Vietnam.

The Government player, commanding South Vietnamese, South Korean and American units, must protect and improve the security of the civilian populations and major highways while seeking and destroying the insurgent forces. The Insurgent player, commanding elements of the National Liberation Front and North Vietnamese army, must undermine the government's power and replace his governing structures with his own.

The mountain is calling! The path is steep, the gorges treacherous. With concentration and skill to the peak of happiness.

This game is similar to Labyrinth except that it has been stood up on its end. The player must move a small metal ball around the path on the board using a system of simple pulleys. Should the ball fall through a hole, you have to start over.
Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point, learn more about folks and country. It is a simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn.

The Neymar Board Game! appears inside the back cover of the book Neymar by Illugi Jökulsson. It follows the life and career of Brazilian soccer star Neymar. It is a simple roll-and-move game where players roll a die to progress along a track. Spaces along the way refer to setbacks and successes in Neymar's life and career, corresponding to moving forward or back on the track or gaining or losing turns. The first player to reach the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

Levy Men (or "Caballeros & Campesinos" in the spanish version) is a set of rules designed to abstractedly simulate combats that represent from skirmishes with dozens of miniatures to big battles with hundreds of miniatures per side.

For 2 players, it was conceived to be played in a fast and dinamic game mode that will allow the players learn and implement the simple rules rapidly.

The objective of the ruleset is to serve as a “starter game” for those not familiar with wargames and, for the experience players as a “filler game” or just a way to play as much fast and masive battles in one gaming day!

item.description: Thrones and Bones is a board game published in the book Frostborn by Lou Anders. It is based on the classic Viking board game Hnefatafl. Thrones and Bones is played on a 9×9 board, and shares the layout of the King's Table version of Hnefatafl. In general, movement and captures are handled as they are in Hnefatafl. However, this game adds a few new elements. The attackers, known as the Draug, have a special "leader" piece known as The Black Draug, who has special movement powers. Also, the starting squares of the attackers, known as the barrow mounds, are impassible to the Jarl and his defenders and also impassible to the Draug minions once they leave the barrow mounds. Only the Black Draug can move to any space on the board with no restrictions. However, the Black Draug is also vulnerable. If he is captured, all his minions are released and Jarl and his defenders win. The Jarl may also win by reaching any edge square other than those in the barrow mounds. As in Hnefatafl, the Draug win by capturing the Jarl by surrounding him on all four sides with Draug pieces or barrow mound squares.

In Taking Food From Bears, each player takes the role of a hiker trying to take food from a bear

At the beginning of the game, each player receives a set of seven cards, with numbers from 1 to 5, 1 whistle, and 1 bear trap. The Bear cards have values 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 15. In a round, players attempt to steal from the target bear by playing his cards in sequence. The first player secretly looks at the target bear (the top bear card) and plays one of his number cards face up. If he plays a "3" card, it means that the player intends to steal 3 food from the target bear. Next players have two options: 1) look at the bear card just as the first player did and play a number card face up; or 2) play a number/whistle/bear card face down, take a multiplier (x2) card from the pool, and put the multiplier card on his face down number card.

After all the players played their cards, the Bear card is revealed. Beginning from the player who played the lowest card, add up the value of the number tokens. Suppose that the Bear is "9" and Josh played "3", Becky "5", Lupita "2", and Samuel "3" with "x2" multiplier on it, Lupita (2), Josh (3), and Samuel (3) are entitled to receive 2, 3, and 6 (3x2) food respectively. However, Becky will receive a wound (worth -2 food at the end of the game), since she fought the bear and lost. 9 is bigger than 2+3+3 but it is smaller than 2+3+3+5. Becky triggered the Bear's wrath. Playing the Whistle card will startle the Bear and trigger each other player to be wounded, but the player playing the Whistle card will receive no food this round. Playing the Trap card will keep the player safe against being wounded, but the player playing the card will receive no food this round. The player that received the most amount of food the last round, going clockwise from the starting player, starts the next round.

Play continues in this manner for a specified number of rounds,or until all the food is depleted, or until one player receives 5 wounds. The player with the most food at the game end is the winner.

link.value: Taking Food From Bears: Bear's Revenge Expansion

item.description: In Match Game, players try to solve 12 questions relating to the placement of a set number of colored matches. The first player to place their matches correctly wins.

Description from the publisher:
You'll need a steady hand to attack this stack!

Roll and play your dice on the center Quake Plate!

You can build up the tower using neighboring numbers only (ie: if there is a 2 dot die as the last played, you can add a 1 dot, or a 3). So which direction should you go? That's part of the strategy! You'll want to play as many dice as you can... but not if it means the tower will topple!

Each player gets 5 dice and a dice rolling cup (everything is color coordinated, so you have a red player, orange play, green player, blue player).

Knock it over, you get no points, whereas each other player receives one point for each die they had in the fallen tower.

Get all your dice onto the tower before it topples? You get points and no one else does!

name.value: Splitters!: Någon djävla ordning ska det va i ett parti

item.description:
Splitters! is a card driven game about the left wing political movement of the 70s. The players take on the rolls of ideologists struggling to have the movement embrace their separate interpretations of socialism. The game either ends when a player successfully achieves three secret goals or when the last card is drawn from the deck, in which case the player who controls the most party members wins.

In the beginning of the game the whole movement is united in the "Party", but during the course of the game the players break out groups of members to form new parties. Each member tile has three opinions, each in different categories (colour, symbol and background). Playing an action card the player combines an action with on of these opinions to rearrange the members on the board - creating new parties, taking control of existing ones or transferring members from one party to another.

Inspired by Monthy Pythons "Life of Brian" Splitters! is a chaotic and humoristic game, which still leaves room for tactical depth.

Description in Swedish:
I Splitters! tar spelarna rollen som ideologer i 70-talets vänsterrörelse för att utkämpa en bitter kamp om vilken tolkning av socialismen som är den rätta. Konsekvensen kan bara bli en: Splittring! Kämpa för din övertygelse i försöken att genomdriva ditt politiska program och samla medlemmar i en miljö där partierna har en tendens att föröka sig like amöbor - genom delning.

Splitters är ett kortdrivet spel där spelarna försöker ta kontrollen över de medlemsbrickor som ligger på bordet. Spelet kan sluta på två sätt - antingen genom att en spelare lyckas uppfylla tre hemliga uppdrag (så kallade Övertygelser) eller när det sista kortet dragits ur högen och segern går till den spelare som kontrollerar flest medlemmar.
Vid spelets början är alla rörelsens medlemmar samlade i "Partiet" mitt på bordet, men under spelets gång bryter spelarna ut grupper av medlemmar som bildar nya partier, med allt längre och allt mer sekteristiska namn. 
Varje medlemsbricka har tre åsikter i olika kategorier (färg, symbol och bakgrund). På sin tur kombinerar spelaren ett handlingskort från sin hand med en av dessa åsikter för att flytta runt medlemsbrickorna på bordet: skapa nya partier, ta över befintliga partier eller flytta medlemmar från ett parti till ett annat.

Inspirerat av Monthy Pythons "Life of Brian" är Splitters! ett kaotiskt och humoristiskt spel om 70-talets vänsterrörelse, som trots slumpfaktorer ändå har taktiskt djup.

item.description:
From the publisher

Iron Bottom Sound III is a re-launch of Jack Greene’s award winning tactical naval combat game of the fighting in the Pacific in 1942-43. This game has been extensively updated from the original and includes twelve scenarios (and additional new rules) as well as additional ships for future scenarios to be made available on line at Quarterdeck International’s ConSim World (CSW) site.

Iron Bottom Sound III includes corrected scenarios from earlier versions, several 1943 actions, one Channel action between the Brits and the Germans, as well as two revised 1928 hypothetical actions between American and Japanese battleships and battlecruisers. The Japanese and Germans have slightly higher Victory Point value as their loss is tougher on them than the Allies.

This boxed bookcase style game (and a STOUT box at that!) weighing OVER a kilo contains the following components:

 One 22.5” x 22” dark blue MOUNTED map.
 Two cut out islands - one is Savo in the old traditional daylight hour’s style and Kolombangara in nighttime shades.
 Two FULL countersheets. The ship counters, in Japanese and English, have top views on one side and silhouettes on the reverse for player’s choice. No generic images either, but the ACTUAL ship is displayed.
 Two COLOR 11” x 17” combat charts, one in English, the other in Japanese.
 Two 32 page rulebooks with scenarios with one ONLY in English. They represent my gaming philosophy of BIG print, plenty of room between lines (translation: EASY TO READ) – and the rulebook portion INCLUDING all optional rules are only 17 pages.
 A 24 page “Ship Log” booklet with the scenario Roster Sheets for playing the scenarios in both English and Japanese, generic ship logs for making your own (as done in THE ROYAL NAVY) and a movement/attack log, all suitable for photocopying. 
 Game counters include all the ships and EXTRA ones too. Also torpedoes, smoke screens (NEW), fires, decoys (NEW), wrecks, fired markers (NEW) and starshells are included. Ships included are the YAMATO, MUTSU, NORTH CAROLINA, COLORADO, the battlecruiser LEXINGTON and more.

item.description:
Lab Wars is the science themed card game of building up your lab and sabotaging your competitors all for scientific glory!

How to play:
Players start play with a research team of 5 lab characters and 3 lab item cards in their hand. At the beginning of each round players will reveal which character they will be playing in a rock, paper, scissors mechanism. When it is the player's turn their character activates an attack (a resource bonus) if another player has played the targeted character and an extra character specific bonus. If a player is successfully sabotaged they also gain a sabotage card decreasing their "Impact point" total (see end).

Players will then purchase lab item cards into their lab area from their hand. Lab items can combine to create combos which give the player more research points of the drawing of more cards. Players may also play action cards which have variable effects. Players gain action cards by the successful sabotage of another player or by playing the professor card.

If players have enough research points they can purchase from an open supply of 3 different "impact cards". They become more expensive to purchase as they get bought up. Players need impact cards to give themselves impact points which are needed to win the game.

Once the player has finished their turn the next player has their turn. Once all players have finished their turn players start over and reveal which new character they will be playing that round. From the beginning of the second round and future rounds each player receives 2 research points and 1 lab item card from the lab item deck.

How to win and end the game:
The game ends at the end of the round when 2 of the 3 supply cards have run out, with the player with the most impact points winning the game. Bonuses are also given to those with the most remaining research points, lab items in their lab area and Nurture paper impact cards.

item.description:
Sherlock Holmes is dead! And with London's greatest detective out of the way, those with villainous minds decide to wreak as much terror as possible on the populace — and you are one of those dastardly no-goodniks!

While Europe sits unprotected in Victorian Masterminds, you and other players send your henchmen to different cities to use their varied abilities, collect material for your steampunk-inspired contraptions, destroy buildings, and complete missions. At the same time, the Secret Service follows your path of destruction. Every contraption is unique and allows you to take different actions, leading to highly strategic, asymmetric gameplay.

In more detail, during the game, players take turns placing one of their five agent tokens — Henchman, Machine, Saboteur, Pilot, Number 2 — face down on one of the five action spaces. As soon as three tokens are on a space, those tokens are flipped and activated, first in first out, with each agent carrying out its individual action in addition to whatever takes place in that space. When an evil mastermind completes their contraption or the Secret Service brings this villainy to a halt, the game ends, and whoever has generated the most victory points wins.

item.description:
Ordnungswissenschaft is a physical game in which four players are moving stacked boxes according to rigid instructions. The players have to execute these instructions in the given order and can only determine when to execute, not what to execute.

5 cubes are stacked in the corners of the space, and the four players stand on the sides of the square playing area, each player between 2 stacks of boxes.

Each player receives 3 sheets of instructions and a green cover sheet. They take each page in turn, following the instructions on the page.

Players win if they have one box on their left at the end of the round.

Hostage Chess is a two-player, abstract strategy board game based on Chess, but including drops of captured pieces similar to Shogi. Unlike shogi, the piece a player may drop is one of his own pieces previously captured by the opponent. In exchange, the player returns a previously captured enemy piece, of equal or greater value, which the opponent may drop on a future turn. This is the characteristic feature of the game. Hostage Chess can be played with an ordinary chess set.

item.description:
The core of codingFarmers is a standard roll-and-move race. However, instead of simply moving the distance rolled, you choose one of two code cards you draw and obey its instructions. Most cards refer to the die roll you made and will move you. Advanced cards involve simple loops and conditionals. The cards are expressed in Java code, so the act of deciding which of the two cards to use requires you to parse simple Java. The board has features (trees, rivers, rocks, etc) that have a normal meaning, and which can be referred to by conditional cards.

From the back of the box:

codingFarmers is the first ever board game to introduce kids to real programming. It is created exclusively by three high school students (Kikhil, Vineet and Anika) who are very passionate about programming and wanted to spread the awareness among kids. In this game, you are the coding farmer. After a long day at work, you decide to race to the barn with your friends. Since you code, your tractors operate on code cards. You have to strategically decode and use the correct set of cards to reach the bard first. This game provides two sets of cards. Action cards have instructions in English as well as Java code. code cards have instructions only in Java code.

Where will you zone for more homes? Get ready to negotiate!
The San Francisco Bay Area faces a housing crisis. With far more people wanting to live here than there are homes, rents have risen to record heights. However, building new housing isn't easy, with concerns about traffic, views, gentrification, and open space, to name just a few. Still, the problem can be solved, though not by San Francisco alone. You'll have to plan and build regionally.

In Bay Area Regional Planner, you'll be given some policy goals to fulfill. On each round, you'll negotiate with the other players to decide where to zone for more housing. Everyone must be in agreement, so get ready to compromise and make coalitions!

Bay Area Regional Planner is for 2-12 players and typical games run 60-120 minutes.

More than a game:
You'll have more than just fun when playing Bay Area Regional Planner: you'll be navigating real world strategies and challenges in the Bay Area planning process. Developed as an educational tool for the San Francisco Bay Area Renters' Federation, Bay Area Regional Planner tries to be as accurate as possible to actual issues and numbers. Game data on commute time and current numbers of housing units are sourced from the Metropolitan Transportation Commission (MTC) and the Association of Bay Area Governments' (ABAG) Bay Area Census. Policy goals are based on actual feedback to regional plans at ABAG's Plan Bay Area public outreach workshops, and the consensus-based decision making is an abstraction of how the public process here works.

Grand Bazaar is a trading game for the family in which players are merchants who want to increase their initial starting capital by buying and selling three types of gems: sapphires, rubies and emeralds.

In more detail, the game lasts 27 rounds. Each round, prices for each type of gem may increase by 1, decrease by 1, or stay unchanged. Players must buy cheap gems to sell them at higher prices later, but this is all about probability and reality as well. To win, you have to diversify your stock, but you are limited on initial capital and the number of gems in the bazaar is limited as well. The first player changes each round clockwise, giving all players equal chances to plan their moves and make short- or long-term investments. At the end of the game, the player with most money wins!

item.description:
In Ð—Ð²Ñ‘Ð·Ð´Ð½Ñ‹Ðµ Ð²Ð¾Ð¹Ð½Ñ‹: Ð¢Ð°Ð¹Ð½Ð¾Ðµ Ð²Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€Ð¶ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ðµ (Star Wars: Secret Invasion) you will infiltrate the Death Star to help Princess Leia get out of prison. Players will be confronted by numerous stormtroopers and Darth Vader himself. Luke Skywalker, Han Solo and Obi-Wan Kenobi will come to the rescue.

Ð—Ð²Ñ‘Ð·Ð´Ð½Ñ‹Ðµ Ð²Ð¾Ð¹Ð½Ñ‹: Ð¢Ð°Ð¹Ð½Ð¾Ðµ Ð²Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€Ð¶ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ðµ, a Star Wars-themed version of Love Letter, is a quick game of luck, determination and deduction. Play character cards, watch out for opponents' actions...and may the Force be with you!

The game is played with only 17 cards. At the beginning of the game, one card is removed at random, then each player draws a card. The game is played in several rounds. Each round represents a stage in the escape plan. At the end of each round, one of the players will get closer to the plan's realization and receive a special token. As soon as someone's got enough tokens, that player will rescue Leia and take her to the Rebel Base.

On their turn, a player draws a card, then plays one of the two cards in hand. Each character card — Princess Leia, Obi-Wan Kenobi, Darth Vader, Luke Skywalker, Chewbacca, C-3PO, R2-D2, Han Solo, Stormtrooper and Boba Fett — has a special ability. In this version of Love Letter, Boba Fett functions the same as a Stormtrooper, with each having the Guard ability of naming a player's role and eliminating them from the round, but with Boba Fett if you miss on the first shot, you can try again. Miss a second time, though, and you're out of the round yourself!

The other difference to regular Love Letter is that the Baron ability is split between the two droids, but with R2-D2, the highest value is out of the round.

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/asteriagames/fallen-angel-0/description

https://www.facebook.com/FallenAngelTheBoardGame/

Fallen Angel is a game integrating dice-worker placement and area-majority scoring as its core mechanism, seamlessly matched with a steampunk fantasy theme.

The game is played in four rounds. Every round players take turns placing one or more dice into any of the nine sections on the game board, and execute the associated actions.

Each section is open for multiple visits, even by the same player, and the associated actions can also be performed repeatedly, as long as the dice placement rules are satisfied.

Besides acting as action-workers, dice also help in the competition for VPs. Every three sections are grouped into one “region”. At the end of a round, within each region, a comparison between each player’s number of dice takes place, VPs are then awarded to the winners.

item.description:
Godrem is an abstract strategy game created by David A. Madrigal. The game is for 2 or 4 players, and it is set in a fantasy world.

The objective of the game is to conquer the 4 red tiles of the map and take control of the Crystal. The players have 6 army units and 1 Oracle to make it. Every Oracle has different abilities that change the development of the battles and they are the only ones with the power to control the knowledge of the crystal... but not without lose something before.

The first player to take control of the 4 red tiles and the Crystal wins the game.

Designed by John Gorkowski, this series enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. In the Trenches (ITT) challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulse-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspire historically accurate play without forcing decisions.

The second Base Set is a grab-bag of great all-new scenarios. First, the green Americans find themselves in a desperate battle with German stormtroopers. Then, the US 327th Tank Battalion rolls into action at Bois de Sonnard. And finally, because you can never have enough tanks, Mark H. Walker gives us an alt-history engagement to round out the set.

This base set includes all the counters you'll need to play these scenarios, PLUS all the status markers and administrative counters you'll need to play any expansion.

Includes:

 176 counters to manouevre
 Three 8.5x11-inch maps
 1 rulebook to rifle through
 1 Player Aid Card and Scenario Card
 1 Game Turn Track




(source: Tiny Battle Publishing website)

link.value: In the Trenches: Coup de Grace
In the Trenches: Through Fire and Flames

item.description:
Welcome, bugs of the forest! This is the Centipede speaking, right from Racing Track. Today, on this sunny morning, I will be your host in this exciting new edition of the Spring Race!

This celebration pits the fastest, smartest and strongest amongst the denizens of the forest in an exciting race to be the 1st to cross the finish line. In order to win, contestants will have to use their wit, brawn and even the help of mighty allies!

So with the contestants already on their starting positions, let the countdown begin...3,2,1...or as we say:

'RUN, BUG, RUN!!!'

In “Run, Bug, Run!” players will compete to be the fastest bug in the yearly Spring Race. Each bug has different attributes and abilities, enabling different strategies in order to be the 1st one to cross the finish line. To do so, players will have to be faster than the others and spend wisely the leaves they gather on race cards, direct attacks and mighty special abilities. In addition, they can opt to check surprise locations, where they can earn extra powerful cards…or be awarded penalties for their avarice

item.description:
A party Game for tolerant people with black humour.

Norway's own "version" of Cards Against Humanity.

What is OK to say? What is not OK at all?
Can we joke about anything? Or are there still taboos within your friend-circle? 
The demand of being PC is spreading everywhere, also in Norway. Is this a damper on freedom of speach? 
Play Politisk ukorrekt (political incorrect) and test your own tolerance.

In Politsk ukorrekt the question cards are white, and the answer cards have 3 colours: bink, light blue and yellow.
all players start with 4 cards of each colour, and at all times have 12 coloured cards in their hand, but which colours might change.

One player starts as judge, draws a white card and reads it out loud. The other players now have to find the coloured card that best fits into the sentence or as an answer to the question.
The cards are shuffled so the judge doesn't know who handed which card in. Whilst you're judge, you can use your time to get rid of a card from your hand and swap it for a new one. 
When everyone has handed in cards and they have been shuffled, the judge read them out loud along with the white card, then choose which is the funniest/best suited. 
The winning player gets the white card.
First player to 5 white cards win the game.

item.description: War Fleet is a block game designed for massive fleets of starships to battle and still be resolved in a reasonable amount of time. The design focuses on admiral level decisions, such as fleet position, command, and starship configuration. It also allows for variable levels of complexity and could easily be expanded to fit a number of settings. The map covers a vast amount of space which can be everything from a large section of deep space to a lone star system. It is designed to work independently or within a Victory by Any Means campaign game

link.value: Victory By Any Means Campaign Series

name.value: Zelph On The Shelf Edition (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)

item.description:
Cards Against Humanity Zelph On The Shelf Edition is a fan-made version of Cards Against Humanity that is designed for ex-Mormon players. Like the regular game, a player selects a black card with fill in the blank text and each player selects one of their white cards to try and find the funniest result. The person playing the black card chooses the funniest response.

This game pokes fun at Mormonism and Mormon Apologetics. The name Zelph refers to a skeleton found by Joseph Smith in Illinois that was uncovered in a Native American mound. He claimed the bones belonged to a warrior named Zelph who had fought in the battles described in the Book of Mormon.

The game can be played independently or integrated with Cards Against Humanity. Like the original game, the humor is very adult in nature and is recommended for mature players. For faithful Mormons, the game is probably especially offensive.

Atomic the card game is a "build and explode" game for 2-5 players, ages 10+. It's based on Chemistry, but don't worry, you won't learn anything.

Gather your Elements. Stick them together with Bonds. Trigger reactions with Catalysts! If your opponents try to stop you with Water, soak it up with a Sponge! Then throw a little Anti-Matter at them and change up the game with a devious Experiment or two!

Genimo is a game of skill that gives you and your opponent the chance to show off your vocabulary. Designed for two players, children or adults, Genimo tests your ability to locate and identify your opponent's word on a special numbered game sheet before he discovers yours.

The game consists of instructions as well as two pads of pages on which to write your word, and according to the instructions, it comes with two "lead pencils." In the first stage of the game, the player must determine where their opponent has put the word, like a simplified Battleship game. The second stage plays like Hangman, with the player guessing letters so they can figure out their opponent's word.
—user summary

Stuck on a dying world, a handful of people take their only chance at survival, a junked space ship. All they need to do is keep it together and working to reach their new home. How hard can that be?

Starship Deathtrap is a cooperative game that can be played solo or up to 5 players. Players will control the movements and actions of one or more of the 5 crew members, each having their own unique expertise.

With the ship starting damaged, the crew is already behind. Each turn consists of 4 phases: Crew phase, disasters spread phase, new disaster phase, and advancement phase.

Crew Phase: Each crew member uses their allotted actions to move, activate ships systems, or fight disasters.

Disaster Phase: Any unstopped disasters will spread causing more problems for the crew.

New Disaster Phase: Each turn a new disaster will be determined (where and what type) randomly by a die roll.

Advancement Phase: Advance your energy level and distance to destination meter.

name.value: No Safe Harbor: The Raid on Darwin

item.description:
From the rules:

"No Safe Harbor is a simulation wargame about the Japanese raids on Darwin Harbor on February 19, 1942.The game is meant for two players, with one player taking on the role of the Japanese attackers and the other the Australian defense forces. The game can easily be played solitaire, however."

The winner has the most victory which are gained differently by each player. The Australian player gains points by eliminating Japanese units and escaping with their naval units, while the Japanese player wins by bombing Darwin and sinking the naval units.

No Safe Harbor is a bonus game included in the 2016 Annual for Against the Odds.

The objective of iCubo is to solve puzzles in the shape of cubes in the minor leasttime. The game includes an hourglass, cards of different values with which to pay for time and to see of one and in order of numeration 7 tracks that will help you to arm the iCubo; and the most incredible thing: 10 iCubos that generate 5 iCubos multicolored too, shaping a real game of revolutionary ingenuity in construction 3D. The game begins the hourglass is turned, which gives 5 minutes to solve the iCubo. From there, everything depends on you and the strategy that you use.

El Objetivo del Juego es armar rompecabezas en forma de cubos en el menor tiempo posible, donde podrán jugar hasta 4 jugadores. El juego cuenta con un reloj de arena, fichas de diferentes valores con las cuales pagar por tiempo y para ver de a una y en orden de numeración las 7 pistas que te ayudarán a armar el iCubo; y lo más increíble: 10 iCubos que generan a su vez 5 iCubos multicolor, conformando un verdadero juego de ingenio revolucionario en construcción 3D. El juego comienza cuando damos vuelta el reloj, contando con 5 minutos para armar el iCubo. A partir de allí, todo depende de vos y la estrategia que utilices para desplegar toda su capacidad.

It’s the ultimate Movie Trivia game experience! Watch hundreds of real movie clips stream on your tablet as two teams go head-to-head in a game of cinema smarts. Think you know the answer? Hit the “Buzz In” button on the game board, and then wager an amount to win or lose. Pop Stream is packed full of over 10 different types of questions and challenges to stump you and your team. And did we mention you can take SELFIES? Simply take your photo and attach it to your in-game character to see a hilarious animated version. Pop Stream combines your favorite movie scenes with the excitement of a game show, right in your living room. Test your movie knowledge with Pop Stream, the ultimate movie trivia game!

A cooperative stacking game to recognize and match colors.

It’s springtime. The buds of the water lilies have already opened. Three big flowers are also growing up on the little island, but have not yet blossomed. Rosalina, in her little bed, is waking up. First she yawns, then stretches and sets off flittering from one water lily leaf to the next.

As she arrives at the little island, she swings her magic wand ... and the three large flowers soon start to bloom. The goal is to build up the flowers before Rosalina reaches the flower island!

On your turn you roll the die and take a piece of the same color. The first piece of a color goes on the same color flower field. The next pieces go on top of the previously placed pieces.

The back of the board is a variant for older children. In this variant you don't have to recognize colors, but shapes.

link.value: HABA My Very First Games series

item.description:
In Vs System 2PCG, players choose a main character, build a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempt to stun the other player's main character in a game of superhero battle. The first set contains characters only from the Marvel Universe, but future sets may add other IPs.

Vs System 2PCG is superficially similar to the original Vs. System collectible card game, but is a completely rebuilt game that takes some inspiration from the original. Combat has been streamlined, the turn structure is different, the resource system has been revamped, and the game is no longer collectible, with cards instead being released in a non-random format. A single box contains a full play-set of all cards.

Vs System: The Defenders sees the loosely affiliated Marvel Universe superhero "non-team" face off against Underworld.

In this sixty-minute game, 2-4 players are the penguin agents — Skipper, Rico, Kowalski and Private — who must carry out secret missions in the Central Park Zoo. And don't waste your time as Officer X is very close to revealing the truth about the penguins!

Are you ready to carry out this mission without breaking the Geneva Conventions?

name.value: Bandes Dessinées: le jeu des collectionneurs

item.description:
Collect comics. Choose her favorite series and complete collections in bookshops or from other collectors.

To earn money, work at the Delcourt-Soleil editor to publish new comics.

Waurie is a Mancala game played on the Cayman Islands where it is traditionally played with nickernuts. It is also known as Island Wari. Unusually for a Mancala game the aim of the game is to empty your side of the board rather than win the most seeds. It is played on a board with 2 rows of 6 holes and a storehouse at each end, starting with 4 seeds in each hole. Turns must start on your side of the board, there is no capturing, but seeds are sown in a player's own store. Sowing the last seed in the player's store gives that player another turn. Waurie can easily be played with a Kalah set.

item.description:
In Tesseract, mighty gods fight each other playing with the Tesseract and the balance of the Universe. The Tesseract is a cosmic cube in constant evolution; it controls all that exists in the Universe, things and beings.

Each part of the Tesseract is defined by one of the three cosmic colors, which represent the three different qualities of the Universe: yellow is the ascending energy, blue is the descending energy, red is the expansive energy. By manipulating the Tesseract, the gods influence the balance and the destiny of the Universe.

Players try to match the Equilibrium cards with the Tesseract’s arrangement, in order to score Power points. By playing Divine Interference cards they can rearrange Tesseract’s surface. At the end of the games, the player with most Power point is the winner

item.description:
Description: In this print & play game, players become paratroopers under the command of General StanisÅ‚aw „Sosab” Sosabowski. „Sosab” and his commandos participate in his operations: from creating the 1st Independent Parachute Brigade in Scotland, through participation in Operation Market-Garden, to the post-war period and efforts to raise awareness of the general’s achievements. Taking part in historical events appearing on cards, players shape their character and develop the four cardinal virtues: courage, justice, prudence, and temperance. The winner is the player who gains the most from the historical experiences on the cards and emerges from the turbulent times with the strongest character.

The aim of the game is to build the character of our paratrooper. Players take part in events which let them develop their virtues: courage, justice, prudence, and temperance (C, J, P, T). Players collect appropriate sets of events and earn points for them, moving their markers on their individual virtue tracks (C, J, P, T). It is important that none of your markers falls too far behind. At the end of the game, a player’s marker with the lowest value (the least developed character trait) is that player’s score. The player with the best score wins.

GAME COMPONENTS 
– 1 game board
– 1 paratrooper card
– 52 event cards
– 4 player boards, representing military service books
– 20 coins or other markers

item.description:
From the publisher:

Help Zazuu find his way home through the dangers of deep space! A Space Adventure Card Game for the whole family!

Zazuu’s Quest is a fun game of strategy, math, & luck where players take a ride through space with Zazuu & his friend, Toki, in a quest to find his home planet. Be the first to explore all 9 regions of the galaxy, evading gamma rays & alien encounters. Designed for 2-4 players, ages 4 and up. The game play is focused on accumulating numeric cards in sequence (1-9) and strategically using wild cards to keep other players from completing the nine card set. Engaging graphics & quality (USA made) cards offer a fun way to engage in logic & cognitive development for young learners.

It's monster mayhem!

All of R.L.Stine's monsters have escaped from his manuscripts and are roaming the streets of Madison, and none of them want to go back... including you!

In Goosebumps: the Board Game everyone plays their favourite monster. Players battle each other in a frantic race along a trail of mayhem and manuscripts, trying to reach the typewriter before it sends them away for good. Only the first monster to reach the typewriter will be saved.

The race is on!! Quick... take a shortcut through the graveyard. But watch out for those pesky humans! And if you fall behind, you can always hitch a ride in the Haunted Car. Just hurry up... before it's too late!

name.value: The Hunted: Twilight of the U-Boats, 1943-45

item.description:
The Hunted is a tactical level game placing you in command of one of several models of WWII U-boats.

Your mission is to destroy as much Allied Shipping and as many Capital ships as possible.....and still come home. Players will find it EXTREMELY challenging to survive an entire tour from 1943 to 1945, at which time, if still alive, you will surrender at port, having done your part on the front lines. If desired, a player may start with a more advanced model of U-boat which may actually increase their chances to survive.

Players MAY be reassigned to a newer model of U-boat under some circumstances, but typically will stay in the same boat until the end of game or until sunk.

link.value: The Hunters: German U-Boats at War, 1939-43

item.description:
A trivia card game. There are three decks of cards, each contain a list of numbered facts, some true ('no bull') and some false ('bullshit'). Players take turns to be read one fact from a card, chosen by a die roll, and must decide if that fact is true or false. If they are correct they keep the card used, if they are wrong the card is returned to the bottom of the deck. Confident players may 'bet' 1, 2 or 3 cards on their answer; if they are correct they will receive this many extra cards from the current deck, if they are wrong they must pay that many cards back to the deck.

Once each deck is exhausted, the player with the most cards from that deck in front of them is declared the winner of that deck, and play moves to the next deck. Once all three decks have been worked through, the game ends. If any player was declared the winner of at least two of the three decks, they win the game. Note that this may not be the player who won the most cards over the whole game. If no player was the winner of at least two of the three decks, then whoever has the most cards in front of them wins the game.

Petopia is a fast-paced, trapping and bluffing card game that a winner is the person who scores the goal of this game. You can choose your representative between dog or cat, who fights to win in the backyard.

All cards will be shuffled and distributed 5 cards per each player.Every player will get the health-token depends on the number of players. For example, 3-5 people will receive 4 tokens per person while 6-8 players will get 5 tokens for each player.Players need to draw a card and set some traps to make competitors lose their health points. Following the rules, you have to tell your opponents some details of those traps that you set up. For example, types of those traps (real trap or fake trap). Moreover, each player needs to bluff and challenge other players to remove the set-up traps or decide to keep those traps there. In case that your opponents remove the real trap, they will not lose any health point. Nevertheless, If they make a wrong decision by keeping them or remove the fake one, they will lose their health points. In the latter case, the player (yourself) who sets up the traps will earn the health point instead. Please see the full description of this game by reading in the later part. (How to play section) Keep in mind that you should not trust anyone but should be aware of what others keep saying. The real relationship might not exist on this backyard.

name.value: Barbarossa File: Deep Battles in Russia, 1941-42

item.description:
Corps to Army level, 36 mis/60 kms per hex, 20-day turns, no Finnish front.

Russian units start face down, and there are 3 different order of battle possibilities:

1. Historical - 3/6 chance, as I remember.
2. From Budyonny's Stables - 2/6 chance: What if the Bolshevik traditionalists *had* completely overthrown Tukhachevsky's modern, mobile doctrine *and* equipment, leaving the Red Army strong in infantry and artillery, and having only weak cavalry/mobile corps, with the one exception of Budyonny's KonArmiya.
3. The Tukhachevsky Twist - 1/6 chance: What if Tukhachevsky had not been purged and had seen through the reorganization of the Red Army into the mobile, "deep battle" forces he and Isserman had envisioned?

Moreover, there are 3 different possible replacement rates, so the German player not only does not know what kind of monster he is attacking, he also doesn't know how strong it is - historical is the maximum. The easier his opponent is, the more and sooner victory objectives he must achieve. PRESSURE ... to over-extend?

From the publisher (translated):
Show your skill for negotiation and get properties.
Manage your territories and countries. You can dominate all the territories and be the "Lord of the countries".
This game is a classic argentine cardgame with variant and more choices to decide, where the players must play with cleverness for making the best business.

From the publisher (Spanish):'
Demostrá tu habilidad para negociar y obtener propiedades. Sorteá las dificultades que te presenta administrar campos y latifundios. Si sos hábil, podrás dominar todos los territorios y convertirte en el Señor de los Campos. Este juego, un clásico argentino, presenta diversas alternativas de desarrollo, donde los participantes deben jugar con astucia y un poco de azar para poder así comprar territorios y realizar buenos negocios.

Berserk: Heroes is a card strategy game. The players take on the roles of two battling heroes, commanding their armies. During the game, you'll recruit creatures to your combat units, use spells, weapons and play event cards to ensure superiority on the battlefield.

A starter pack of Berserk: Heroes contains a ready battle deck and a matching hero. You will find everything you need to start playing in the starter pack. Your opponent will need his own starter box too.

Berserk: Heroes key points:

 Berserk: Heroes is a brand new collectible card game for all fans of the legendary Berserk – the most dynamic CCG in Russia.
 The battles became more dynamic fluid. Players take turns more often. The game in played in the same stunning Laar universe, inhabited by beloved characters, but the game mechanics is significantly different compared to the original Berserk.
 Exciting Berserk rules have become more accessible and streamlined. Even inexperienced players can enjoy the new Berserk.
 Regular tournaments are organized. Fans of this popular strategy game meet to fight with each other and engage in combat using creatures, spells and weapons.

item.description:
Math Rummy is a children's educational game designed to teach basic addition and subtraction. It was released in the Leapfrog My Card Games set. Although it shares a name, it bears little resemblance to the classic card game Rummy.

In Math Rummy, each player is dealt eight cards, each of which show a number (both the numeral and picture showing the matching number of cartoon bugs in a jar) or a plus or minus sign. On each player's turn he or she discard cards by making an equation (x +/- y = z) on the board. If the player cannot do so, he or she draws a card from the draw deck or chooses a face-up card that left next to the draw deck. If an equation still is not possible, the player places one card of his or her choice on the face-up pile next to the draw deck and passes. Once the first equation is made, all players play off that same equation on their turn by covering all or part of it with new cards, making sure to keep the equation correct. After each player's turn, a marker is advanced on a turn track. The game ends when one player uses all of his/her cards or when the turn marker reaches the lily pad after turn ten. In that case, the player with the fewest cards wins.
